attributes.action: Criticism of RELIGION must not be criminalised in a secular state.
attributes.additional_details: This petition is needed because the government is set on a course of action that could by default censor the British public's ability to openly examine or criticise a religion. This governement is creating a council that would draw up an official definition of ‘Islamophobia’ of which the next step would be the potential to impose a blasphemy law.  A secular society cannot allow critique of a religion to be branded as hate speech or racism. The government must protect free speech, not censor it.
attributes.background: In a secular society all religions must accept that their worldview will be examined and criticised in open dialogue and debate. This government must make a commitment to protect free speech as regards a citizen's right within a secular society to examine and criticise any religion or ideology.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

The Government have said that they are not going to introduce blasphemy laws:
https://hansard.parliament.uk/Commons/2024-12-18/debates/ba455fa1-fb15-4e1b-b4c9-884dfdaeb83e/CommonsChamber#contribution-76ACDC1C-F8FF-4664-AA99-BE235577FE72

It is therefore unclear what further action you would like the Government or Parliament to take.
